questions.text: In case of death in police custody, the inquest is held by
questions.solution:
In India, Magistrate's inquest is done as per Sec. 196 BNSS, in cases of -

  1. Death while under police interrogation
  2. Death due to police firing/lathi charge
  3. Death/Rape/Disappearance of a person in the police custody or in any other custody authorized by the Magistrate/Court (Jail, Remand home, Borstal school etc.)
  4. Death of a mentally ill prisoner in a psychiatric hospital
  5. Suicide/Suspicious death of a woman within 7 years of her marriage (To rule out dowry death)
  6. Exhumation etc.

Note: Previously, in cases of Death/Rape/Disappearance of a person in the police custody or in any other custody authorized by the Magistrate/Court (Jail, Remand home, Borstal school etc.), Judicial Magistrate's inquest was compulsory. As of Sec. 196 BNSS, any Magistrate can hold an inquest in such cases.

questions.text: Perjury is punishable under?
questions.solution:
• Sec. 227 BNS → Giving false evidence (Perjury) - Definition
  • Sec. 228 BNS → Fabricating false evidence - Definition
  • Sec. 229 BNS → Punishment for Sec. 227 & 228 BNS (Up to 7 years of imprisonment)
  • Sec. 234 BNS → Issuing or signing false certificate (Punishment is same as for giving false evidence)

questions.text: Direction given by a person that, in future if he/she becomes terminally ill and becomes an incompetent patient whether to give medical treatment or not is known as
questions.solution:
• Supreme Court has recognised Advance medical directive or Living will, means direction given by a person that, in future if he/she becomes terminally ill and becomes an incompetent patient whether to give medical treatment or not.
  • As per Mental health care Act 2017, Every person, who is not a minor, have a right to make an advance directive in writing, specifying the way the person wishes to be cared/not to be cared for and treated for a mental illness.
  • Testamentary capacity means, ability of a person to make a valid will.

questions.text: In case of kleptomania, the person is
questions.solution:
• Section 22 of BNS states that "Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, by reason of mental illness, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law".
  • In case of kleptomania, he knows very well that what is he doing and also he knows very well that, what is he doing is wrong. So, a kleptomaniac is punishable under Sec. 22 BNS.
  • Sec. 23 BNS: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is, by reason of intoxication, incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong, or contrary to law; unless that the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.
  • Sec. 24 BNS: In cases where an act done is not an offence unless done with a particular knowledge or intent, a person who does the act in a state of intoxication shall be liable to be dealt with as if he had the same knowledge as he would have had if he had not been intoxicated, unless the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.

questions.text: Death by medical negligence by a doctor can be booked under BNS section:
questions.solution:
• Sec. 125 BNS → Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to two thousand five hundred rupees, or with both, but-
    • (a) where hurt is caused, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees, or with both;
    • (b) where grievous hurt is caused, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to ten thousand rupees, or with both.
  • Sec. 106 BNS → Causing death by negligence - (1) Whoever causes death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if such act is done by a registered medical practitioner while performing medical procedure, he shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

questions.text: The Following is victim of firearm injury. What is the suspected distance of the shot?
questions.solution: • In this picture, there is wound of entry with blackening and tattooing which indicates that the range is beyond the reach of the flame, but within the reach of soot & smoke and powder particles, i.e., near shot/range.

questions.text: All the following are associated with burns of hydrofluoric acid EXCEPT
questions.solution:
• Acids cause coagulative necrosis, except hydrofluoric acid which causes liquefactive necrosis.
  • It causes severe throbbing pain, tissue destruction and necrosis.
  • Also, hydrofluoric acid causes
    • Acidosis
    • Hypocalcaemia
    • Hypomagnesemia
    • Hyperkalaemia

questions.text: Which of the following is the feature of female skull?
Any hurt is grievous, provided the victim is unable to follow his ordinary pursuit for a minimum period of
questions.solution:
Sec. 116 BNS → The following kinds of hurt only are designated as "grievous", namely:--

(a) Emasculation;

(b) Permanent privation of the sight of either eye;

(c) Permanent privation of the hearing of either ear;

(d) Privation of any member or joint;

(e) Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint;

(f) Permanent disfiguration of the head or face;

(g) Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth;

(h) Any hurt which endangers life or which causes the sufferer to be during the space of fifteen days in severe bodily pain, or unable to follow his ordinary pursuits.

questions.text: The maximum age of the person by the analysis of carpal bones in this X-ray is
questions.solution:
In this X-ray, all the carpal bones have appeared except pisiform.

So, the age of the child is >4 years (Scaphoid, traphezium and traphezoid have appeared) and <12 years (Pisiform has not appeared). Out of options, the maximum age is 10 years.

choices.text: Singeing of eyebrows and facial hair
Blackish soot deposit on posterior part of tongue

questions.text: A 38-year-old female presented to the emergency with extensive burns. The patient had grade 3 burns on the face, back upper arms and forearms along with singeing of hairs. Which of these is not a proof of inhalation burns?
questions.solution:
• By definition, inhalation injury is injury to the oropharynx, nasopharynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs from exposure to smoke or heated gas.
  • Soot deposit is due to the inhalation.
  • Oxides of nitrogen liberated during burns may convert sputum into yellow.
  • Mucosal injury may cause hoarseness and stridor. Singeing will not happen by inhalation.

choices.text: Same dose of PASV in infants as compared to adults
Sensitivity test is not required before PASV
Common cobra venom acts at pre-synaptic region
Common krait venom causes both internal and external ophthalmoplegia

questions.text: WRONG statement regarding snake venom and PASV
questions.solution:
• Children and pregnant women receive the same ASV dosage as adults. The ASV is targeted at neutralizing the venom. Snakes inject the same amount of venom into adults and children.
  • No ASV test dose must be administered: Test doses have been shown to have no predictive value in detecting anaphylactic or late serum reactions and should not be used. These reactions are not IgE mediated but Complement activated. They may also pre-sensitize the patient and thereby create greater risk.
  • Common cobra → Neurotoxins get fixed at post synaptic region. Hence, neostigmine has a role, whereas in case of common krait, the neurotoxins get fixed at pre-synaptic region. Hence, neostigmine has no role.
  • Common krait venom is neurotoxic which causes both internal and external ophthalmoplegia manifesting with ptosis.

choices.text: Causing miscarriage with the consent of the mother
Causing miscarriage without the consent of the mother
Causing death of the mother by miscarriage
Causing death of quick unborn child while trying to kill mother

questions.text: Section 90 of BNS deals with
questions.solution:
Sec. 88 BNS → Causing miscarriage with woman's consent.

Sec. 89 BNS → Causing miscarriage without woman's consent.

Sec. 90 BNS → Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage.

Sec. 91 BNS → Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth.

Sec. 92 BNS → Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide.

questions.text: According to the MTP Act 2021, in case of pregnancy due to contraceptive failure, MTP is allowed till what gestation age?
questions.solution:
Grounds for MTP:

  1. Up to 20 weeks in case of
    • Failure of contraceptive in a woman or her partner
  2. Up to 24 weeks in cases of:
    • Rape (The S.C. has included wife conceiving out of forced sex can seek abortion)
    • Incest
    • Minors
    • Change of marital status during the ongoing pregnancy (widowhood and divorce)
    • Women with physical disabilities
    • Mentally ill/MR women
    • Foetal malformation
    • Women with pregnancy in humanitarian settings or disaster or emergency situations as may be declared by the Government
  3. MTP can be done even after 24 weeks in case of:
    • Substantial fetal abnormalities diagnosed by a Medical Board which consist of → a Gynaecologist; a Paediatrician; a Radiologist or Sonologist; and any other nominated by the state government/union territory
  4. MTP can be done at any time, even by a single RMP, if it is immediately necessary to save the life of the pregnant woman

questions.text: The type of stab wound caused by a screwdriver over the thigh is known as
questions.solution:
• A stab wound may be caused by a sharp pointed weapon (e.g., knife) where the external wound looks like an incised wound or a blunt pointed weapon (e.g., iron rod), where the external wound looks like a lacerate wound.
  • The type of stab wound caused by a screwdriver over the thigh is known as lacerated punctured wound

choices.text: Yellow needle shaped crystals of Spermine picrate is seen in Florence test
Dark brown rhombic crystals of Choline iodide are seen in Barberio's test
Both Choline and Spermine can be detected by Thin Layer Chromatography
Detection of sperm specific LDH isoenzyme cannot confirm seminal stain

questions.text: Regarding semen, TRUE statement is:
questions.solution:
• Barberio's test: Spermine present in semen reacts with picric acid to form yellowish needle shaped crystals of spermine picrate
  • Florence's test: Choline from semen reacts with Florence solution (potassium iodide + iodine + distilled water) to form brownish rhomboid shaped crystals of choline iodide
  • Thin layer chromatography is the only test to detect both choline and spermine in seminal stain
  • The only absolute proof of semen in the finding of at least one unbroken spermatozoon or electrophoretic LHD isoenzyme detection of sperms.

questions.text: 'Mule' is
questions.solution:
• Mule/Body packer → Who swallows & pack his GIT with bags of illicit drugs to smuggle
  • Body pusher → Who conceal drugs in rectum/vagina/both
  • Body stuffer → Who ingests drugs in possession to conceal the evidence from police.

questions.text: State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission can pass maximum compensation of
questions.solution: • As per The Consumer Protection Act, 2019 (CPA), there are three levels of Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission. Accordingly, the District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission can pass a compensation of up to Rs. 50 lakhs, the State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission can pass a compensation of more than 50 lakhs, but less than 2 crores and the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission can pass a compensation of more than 2 crores (As per an amendment).

questions.text: Pink teeth in decomposed bodies is seen in case of death due to
questions.solution:
• Pink teeth in decomposed bodies is due to seepage of Hb or its derivatives (protoporphyrin) into the dentinal tubules
  • Seen in about 1 to 2 weeks after death
  • Usually associated with water immersion
  • Not related to any cause of death

questions.text: Which among the following is the 'En bloc' method used in autopsy?
questions.solution:
Evisceration Methods (Techniques of autopsy):

i. Letulle's technique:

  • Described by Letulle.
  • Also known as, 'En masse' or 'En bloc' dissection
    • En masse = In a group; all together
    • En bloc = All together or all at the same time
  • In this technique, oral, cervical, thoracic, abdominal, and pelvic organs are removed as one large organ block.
  • Leaves all attachments intact.
  • Commonly done in medical colleges to teach students

ii. Virchow's Method:

  • Organ by organ removal
  • Individual organ removal one by one.
  • Subsequent dissection of isolated organs.
  • Useful for assessing individual organ pathology.
  • Quick and effective for single organ focus.
  • Most common method in India

iii. Ghon's technique:

  • Developed by Ghon.
  • Also known as, 'Block by block' dissection
  • Cervical & thoracic organs, abdominal organs and the urogenital system are removed as separate organ blocks.

iv. Rokitansky's technique:

  • Developed by Rokitansky.
  • Also known as In-situ dissection
  • Organs dissected in situ with minimal evisceration.
  • Rarely performed.
  • Done in infected & suspected infection cases.
